definition[0]: something that makes you feel better when you are sad or disappointed
example[0]: If it’s any consolation, things do get easier as the child gets older.
example[1]: He had the consolation of knowing that he couldn’t have done any better.
example[2]: The fact that there has been a reduction in crime is little consolation to victims of crime.
example[3]: The only consolation for the team is that they get a chance to play the game again.
